entry.title: Bitcoin
entry.content:
In today’s Reading Senimer, I watched a video about Bitcoin, which I found it very interesting.

What is Bitcoin?

Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency invented in 2008 by an unknown person called Satoshi Nakamoto and started in 2009 when its implementation was released as open-source software. It is a decentralized digital currency without a central bank or single administrator that can be sent from user to user on the peer-to-peer bitcoin network without the need for intermediaries. Transactions are verified by network nodes through cryptography and recorded in a public distributed ledger called a blockchain.

How to obtain Bitcoins?

There are two main method to obtain Bitcoin.

First is using common currency to exchange bitcoin. The exchange rate now is 1 bitcoin for 18980.8 US Dollar.

The second method is mining. Mining is a way which using computer to process a programme, when the result processing out is with in a range, the processer which also called miner can get a reward of bitcoins.

Mining

It is a record-keeping service done through the use of computer processing power. Miners keep block chain consistent, and unalterable by repeatedly grouping newly broadcast transactions into a block, which is then broadcast to the network and verified by recipient nodes. Each block contains a SHA-256 of the previous block, thus linking it to the previous block and giving the blockchain its name.

Early bitcoin miners used GPUs for mining, as they were better suited to the proof-of -work algorithm than CPUs. Later amateurs minded bitcoins with specialized FPGA and ASIC chips. Today, high-performance mining hardware is used.

entry.title: Paragraph writing:My Biggest academic achievement
entry.content:
My biggest academic achievement

My biggest and most successful academic achievement happened during the last term of my studies at JingLing High School.

When I received my mid-term exam report, I felt a bit disappointed initially because of the bad score I got and I was very envious that other people could go home happily, with their report cards full of A*. It, however, didn’t discourage me. To the contrary, I became more motivated to improve myself. One day, I read an article about the importance of accumulation which really impressed me a lot, it said that accumulating some knowledge every day would have a great impact on you, so I decided to try it as part of my learning and revision strategies.

After school, I collected the notes for different subjects and reviewed the previous contents. I also tried to write down the question I met when learning and consult others to solve them all. These tasks gradually became my habit and I did them on a daily basis. A month later, I had sorted out a whole book of study notes and questions. This studying method was really useful and it helped me lay out a more solid foundation of knowledge. Compared with the past, my study time after school was better planned and managed, which make me feel satisfied. When the final exam came along, I still followed these strategies and carefully finished the daily tasks instead of doing the revision crazily until midnight. Unlike the other students, I didn’t feel too nervous because I knew I had prepared well . During the exam, I did my best just like I always do.

The result, in the end, was a bit unexpected, but in a sense it was predictable due to my improved study skills. I got first place in this final exam of this semester in my class which was a great achievement for me.

However, it should be noted that success will never be the reason why you stop working hard and the achievements can be extremely satisfying and rewarding but what can be as important is the good habits that you have developed and the harvest you get. From this successful experience, I am truly aware of the importance of knowledge accumulation. Just like the saying goes: “Constant dripping wears away a stone.” Undeniably, a drop of water has very weak strength which seems to be useless. It, however, will be powerful if the water continues to drop. The same is true of learning. Spending only 10 minutes to review the topic one day may seems useless, but if you keep doing this task every day, you will have much more extra reviewing time than others. Now, I always spend some time to take some notes to sort out what I have learned that day. What’s more, I also learned that confidence only comes from being well-prepared.

Though I made such a big academic achievement in this exam, there are more difficulties and challenges waiting for me. I should combine my success and failure experiences and learn from them to improve myself.

entry.title: Paragraph writing:the biggest failure I experienced
entry.content:
This series of blogs are all stort paragraphs which record my daily experiences, feelings and thoughts. These can be used for the essay writing.

The biggest failure I experienced

Failure has happened to everyone, and sometimes they are caused by success.

The most painful experience I’ve ever had was at the end of my eighth grade when I came first in my final exam. I still clearly remember how ecstatic I was when I got the report card. I couldn’t wait to tell my classmates the good news and enjoy their admiration. I felt so proud of my achievement and felt like everything would come easily to me in the future. There was no doubt that I was overconfident.

Later that day, I was informed by my teacher to share the successful experiences at the parents’ meeting the following week. That was a surprising news for me, I had visions of professional speakers giving wonderful talks to enthralled audiences and I felt that was who I was; an experienced performer going to the stage calmly, having loud voice, clear logic and giving some creative ideas from time to time. So, in the following days before the parents’ meeting, I didn’t do any preparation. I kept telling myself that if I had got an A grade, then a speech would be simple.

But of course I would pay a heavy price for this arrogance and blind self- confidence and it became immediately apparent on stage that there was a gap between my ideals and reality. I finally realized a gap did exist between ideal and reality when standing on the stage. Suddenly, I had a blank mind and words failed me. Without any preparation, I couldn’t read the speech text directly so as to avoid embarrassment, I had to use some trite principles to fill the gaps in my mind. The speech was completely illogical and boring, with several seconds of silence when I couldn’t say a word. I felt awful. Seeing some parents sitting beside the stage becoming a little impatient, my self-confidence disappeared. My voice became smaller and smaller. I finished my speech in a hurry and ran out of the classroom without looking up. I felt ashamed and considered this as my biggest failure.

Success can be used as a driving force for people to move forward or as a reason for laziness. The lesson I have learnt from this humbling experience is that confidence is essential but overconfidence can lead to problems. As the saying goes, failure is the mother of success. Both failure and success should be faced accordingly on their own terms.

[YL1]Use paragraph indents and line spacing to make your writing easier to read

[YL2]If you use the comparative – “er” or” more than” you have to compare the adjectives to something else. For example, “She is smarter than her sister.” Or you just say “She is smart”. So here you need to compare yourself to how you were before.

An interesting concept when you consider who you are.

entry.title: Quantitative investment
entry.content:
This is the first time I heard this word, “quantitative investment”.

It can be considered as a investment which totally bases on data.(From Google: Quantitative investing, also known as systematic investing, is an investment approach that uses advanced mathematical modelling, computer systems and data analysis to calculate the optimal probability of executing a profitable trade.)

Stock certification

Stock is all of the shares into which ownership of the corporation is divided. It can be trade on the stock market. Imagine that you want to buy an apple, the original price of one apple is 3 yuan. A lot of people want to buy it, so some people are willing to buy it in 3.1 yuan. Hence, the price of an apple now becomes 3.1 yuan. As the price of apple get higher, less people want to buy it in the price of 3.1 yuan, so the price of an an apple then drops back to 3 yuan. You can consider the apple as a share. That is the reason why the stock value fluctuate all the time.

How is the quantitative investment carried out

First, the computer analysis the data of stock market in previous year and it can predict whether the stock value will raise or drop. Then, computer can judge if the investors need to buy this stock or sell through a programme.

Characteristics of quantitative investment

  1. It is carried out by a computer. In reality, the data needed is over 100T , which people can only rely on computer to circulate.

  2. People believe the result from the computer in most conditions, unless the result goes against the financial principles.

  3. A lot of math knowledge are used when programming, e.g. linear regression(which also be used in AI)

  4. What a programme needs to improve most is its operating speed since other people can buy stocks when the price is low and sell it at higher price but you can only buy the stock which other people sell(higher price) and sell at low price.

It is hard for people to speculate in stock in the future because more and more people use computer to finish the task which is much more efficient than those people who do market research.

The ways to expand the business of a restaurant

Han

Nowadays, people concern more about what they eat and how the eat, which promote the rapid development of catering industry. It is surprising found that the growth rate of this industry is more than 10% higher than that of other industries in recent years. [Need a reference for this statement] Many small restaurants have to expand their business in order to maintain competitiveness in the market. [why?] For the topic of how a popular local restaurant could expand its business and operate successfully in different regions, I suggest that both chain and franchise model can be considered.

In terms of the chain model, it is an operation method which manage many stores in different regions of country or world with the same brand, same products and same store policies by the same parent company.[Again, need a reference] The parent company has full control of his chain stores, and as a result, it needs to take responsibility for everything of his branches, including profits. In China, there is a famous hotpot restaurant, which is operated in the form of chain store, called Haidilao Hot Pot. So far, it has already had 117 chain stores all over China. Through 20 years of hard work, Haidilao gradually has more than 20000 employees from an unknown hot pot brand. [You could have used the Haidilao corporate report as a reference]

Chain model has many advantages. First, because of the complete control of the owning chain stores, it can perfectly present its successful business philosophy, such as the ways of cooking and the sources of food material, avoiding many unnecessary costs while expanding. Second, the owner can receive high revenue from every chain store [that they own] of his. Apart from the basic cost for operating the shops, the brand owner can receive all rest of the money. However, disadvantages exist. There is a huge amount of initial cost when new branches are built. This is because the parent company should take responsibility to everything of the branches, including the cost of construction and decoration. Also, opening chain stores has a huge demand for management talents, which it’s difficult to hire. If any branch goes wrong in management, the company and its owner will bear a great loss, both in financial and reputation aspect. [A good discussion, but needs to be supported by references]

Another way to expand is running the franchising model. A franchise business is a business owned by an entrepreneur, offering products or services labeled by a corporation that provide assistance in every aspect of business, in return for fees based on profits. [Again, need a reference]To expand the business scale, the brand owner need to hire employees. But the owner won’t make rules on how the employees run their franchising store. [Most franchises (such as Subway) have strict rules in the contract on how the franchise is run. The franchisee will have control over staffing] He just negotiate with them about the profit sharing and make a contract. In this way, the business can expand into a very large scale in a very short time, one example is that “A Little”, a popular milk-tea shop in China, it has successfully expand over 2000 stores in China which only spent about 15 years. [Again, need a reference]

For the advantages of this operation method, franchising can expand quickly and has little initial cost [to the franchise owner], which is especially suitable for those small catering business. The owner don’t need to pay anything for the opening of one of his franchising store because the whole managing tasks as well as responsibility are undertook by his employees. What’s more, the brand owner won’t bear too much risk to go bankrupt. Since there is no much initial cost and investment, though some of the stores may lose money in business, this has little effect on the total profit revenue. However, one serious drawback of franchising model is that the reputation of the brand image may be easily damaged. Without any guidance, the employees may make fatal mistakes which lead to bad reputation to the whole brand. [Also it may cost a lot of time and money to prepare the franchise rules and build the brand]

In a word, both method to expand the local restaurant’s business, chain model and franchising model, have advantages and drawbacks. Chain model can help the owner control the chain stores well and receive high revenue from each shop, but it has high initial cost and poor management will cause great loss. Franchising model expand quickly and has little initial cost and bear relatively low risk, but the reputation of brand may be damaged easily. For the local popular restaurant, the owner needs to determine which model to choose according to his own financial and workers’ condition, or combine two method together in order to expand its business and operate successfully in different regions.

Everyone in life will face an unfamiliar situation and environment and it is vital to confront it in the right way. Adjusting to an unfamiliar situation happened to me when I attended a business study project called Eight Valley three month s ago . In this project, I learned about knowledge about new retailing and created a plan for designing a retail store with business partners . The course was mainly divided into two stages. The first part consisted of learning the theory of retail management which included topics such as the type of retail shop and the way to make the store more attractive. In the second part, team members held team discussions to make a store designing plan and prepare for the final road show , which was the last and the biggest activity of this program. We designed a activities which allows shoppers to design their own shoes pattern.

Undeniably, the course content was really interesting, but the things that made me feel a little bit uncomfortable was that the other team members were students who was older than me , even there was one graduate. I didn’t know any of them and I was in a totally new environment. Moreover, since the knowledge of new retailing was brand new to me, I seldom came up with any creative ideas. Some of the older students, however, had much more active thinking and thought a lot of good ideas. In such an unfamiliar environment, I became shy to express my opinions and communicate less than others. Though I attended this project from the beginning untill the end, I still did not have too much sense of participation because of my wrong attitude and inability to adapt the unfamiliar situation.

After the course, I shared my feelings with my parents and teachers and I realized that it is necessary for me to learn how to integrate in an unfamiliar circumstance since I still need to face these problems after I work. Otherwise, it may make me lose many valuable job opportunities . I learned that one of the most important factors in life is confidence and being assertive with your viewpoints even if they may be controversial or rom a minority point of view. This is the process of learning. Always try your best to integrate into the group. Therefore, you can have more sense of participation and gain more experience whatever task you do or whoever you cooperate with.

entry.title: The understanding of the asset management industry
entry.content:
When I read the book “ monetary finance”, I was confused about the concept of “ sort of bank credit assets “, I discussed this topic with my mother, and consulted with related experience of the elder. Hence, i got involved in and initially discussed a relatively unpopular topic in the financial industry, namely “distressed asset Management”, or “AMC”. What I learned later aroused my interest: AMC industry started late in China, with huge scale and broad market prospect, but there are very few professionals engaged in this industry. After an internship at an asset management company, I got a better understanding of the industry.

Generally speaking, the NPL in the market refer to the NPL of financial institutions and more to the non-performing creditor’s rights of banks, among which the most important is the non-performing loan (refers to the loan that the bank customers cannot repay the principal and interest on schedule and in amount. ).

For the banks, non-performing assets are a burden and drag, non-performing assets shackle hands and feet, so that the bank is difficult to implement development; For investors in bad assets, the huge profit space of bad assets is very attractive, so that countless investors participate in it one after another. From the perspective of investors, the current global economic downturn, downward pressure is huge, the development of many areas are facing bottlenecks, even challenges, and non-performing assets, known as the best counter-cyclical investment, is thriving and booming. From the perspective of financial institutions’ risk prevention and sound operation, it is very important and necessary to divest and dispose of non-performing assets, just like a sick person has to seek medical treatment or even surgical resection.

Bad assets are not worthless assets. The famous investment guru Graham once said, “There are no bad assets to invest in, only bad prices to buy.” What’s more, most of the time these assets are not worthless junk because of a lack of proper operations or temporary difficulties due to the economic cycle. Therefore, smart NPL investors will practice contrarian thinking, buy at the right price, dispose of it properly, and then wait for the right time to sell it, thus making a huge profit. In fact, NPL is a typical industry of turning waste into treasure. For excellent gold diggers, NPL disposal industry hides huge treasure. Westerners refer to distressed asset management companies (AMCs) as “vultures that eat rotten meat”.

I also learned that China’s finance started very late, and there is still a big gap between China and Europe and America. From a global perspective, the best choice to study accounting and finance is to go to the UK. Britain’s financial industry is highly developed. According to OECD statistics, the UK’s GDP in 2019 was 2,214.8 billion pounds, of which the value of finance and insurance was 129.6 billion pounds, accounting for more than 5%. Currently, the UK is the world’s largest exporter of financial services, is the global influence of the international financial center of London, London ranked first in the total cross-border banking, London has the world’s largest foreign exchange market, London is in the world in the field of international bond issuance and trading, gold, silver trading volume in the world’s first.

Therefore, I really hope to study accounting and finance in university. This will help me better enter the asset management industry in the future.

entry.title: Study on the Sustainable Factors of Fair activities
entry.content:
市集活动可持续性影响因素研究

刘沐阳，韩佳睿

（南京市金陵中学国际部, 江苏 南京 210005）

摘要： 市集活动作为一种传统的销售模式，它的价值不仅仅是一种商业贸易模式，更多的是一种传统贸易文化的载体。本文构建了基于生命周期理论的市集可持续性发展概念模型，提出了六个影响因素：资源能力、运营能力、政策环境因素、经济环境因素、社会环境因素和技术环境因素。采用李克特五级量表进行问卷调查，在对样本数据进行信效度分析的基础上，验证了资源能力和政策环境因素显著支持市集可持续性。

关键词： 市集活动；可持续性；影响因素

Study on the Sustainable Factors of Fair activities

Liu Muyang, Han Jiarui

(International Department of Nanjing Jinling High School, Nanjing, Jiangsu, 210005)

Abstract: as a traditional sales mode, fair activity is not only a commercial trade mode, but also a carrier of traditional trade culture. This paper constructs a conceptual model of market sustainable development based on life cycle theory, and puts forward six factors: resource capacity, operation capacity, policy environment, economic environment, social environment and technological environment. Based on the reliability and validity analysis of the sample data, this paper uses Likert five scale to conduct a questionnaire survey, and verifies that resource capacity and policy environment factors significantly support the fair sustainability.

一、引言

​ 市集活动作为一种传统的销售模式，已经存在上千年了，所以它的价值，已经不仅仅是一种商业贸易模式了，更多的则是一种传统贸易文化的载体。随着网络的普及与发展，线上购物逐渐成为主流购物方式，而线下购物模式逐渐被人们淡忘，尤其是传统的市集活动正面临彻底被取代、消失的风险。还记得几年前的台北士林夜市上，人来人往，街道被堵的水泄不通，游客们三五成群，手里各捧着购买到的心仪商品，悠闲地逛着市集。火爆的人气也吸引了当时一大部分商家蜂拥而至。因此每到点灯时刻，士林夜市俨然成为整个台北的焦点。可就是这么一个兼人气与口碑为一体的市集，在几年后竟无人问津，许多商家撤离，败在了高速发展的互联网脚下。

​ 综上所述，市集活动的销声匿迹，无法快速应对外界环境的变化，为了延续与传承这种文化，让市集活动重新进入大众视野显得尤为重要。在市集发展的过程中，需要面临复杂的内外环境变化，如何应对变化实现持续发展成为焦点问题。市集主办方需要了解如何创新，吸引更多顾客，如何利用现有资源来实现市集可持续发展。因此，对市集活动可持续性研究主要有以下意义：从理论价值上分析，实现市集可持续性发展，是对市集商业模式与文化的保护与传承，部分研究内容即为影响可持续性因素可供其他类似商业模式借鉴，以此来实现多元化的商业模式持续发展。从现实意义上分析，在互联网技术飞速发展的时代，实体经济往往被大众所忽视。通过分析影响市集活动可持续性因素，应用在发展实体经济上，有利于实体经济与互联网经济相互补充、借鉴，也有助于促进它们的共同发展。

二、研究综述与模型构建

（一）研究综述

1. 市集的内涵与作用

​ 集市是城市的重要起源之一，集市的产生完成了农牧业人口向非农业人口的转移，也是集市这种特殊的形式造就了人口密度高于农村的城市。在城市最初的形态中，市集与集市几乎是同一个含义。相较于集市，市集活动更灵活、多变、形态多样，是一种有特定主题的集市。向上（2012）认为集市的形态非常多样，有据守街边的 , 有盘踞广场的, 有占领几个街区的 有深藏闹市的 , 也有濒临水边的，有室内的, 也有露天的形态。巨大的偶然性和它的自发性有一定关系, 成功的集市会不断扩张 , 失败的集市会自然销声匿迹[1]。有学者研究创意市集，有学者研究文艺市集，还有研究各类主题的市集，如翁旨远（2017）所研究的创意市集，他走访杭州转塘地区围绕中国美术学院形成的多处艺术市集的数据和经验，对比了校园市集、学生市集、设计师集成店、外来市集四类艺术市集在商业诉求、学术价值、艺术水平方面的异同，发现艺术市集固然在城市艺术创意氛围营造和调节产业结构方面有推动作用[2]。在市集运营方面，徐皞亮（2019）着重分析了创意市集产品的特色和属性，探究其与消费者特质，消费心理偏好等因素之间的关系，从中总结出“价格导向型”和“产品导向型”两大消费群体，并提出了针对性营销策略，为创意市集从业者提高文创产品的销售质量提供了参考和建议[3]。

2. 可持续商业模式的概念化研究

​ 要了解市集可持续性发展，就必须先知道什么是可持续的商业模式。早在2015年，朱明洋，林子华（2015）就对此进行了解释分析。可持续性是商业模式的重要构成要素，由于商业环境的不断变化，可持续性也一直是企业的不断追求[4]。一开始，Bansal 和 Roth（2000）认为企业在提高核心竞争力和生态环境责任的压力下追求可持续发展[5]。到后来，Ekwueme 和Hussain结合CSR中的“三重底线”（即经济，社会，生态责任底线）研究了企业追求可持续发展的原因，认为企业追求可持续性由商业模式的价值决定[6-7]。世界环境与发展委员会（WCED）增在发布的《我们共同的未来》中提出可持续发展的概念，也指出可持续商业运作、其合适的商业模式以及其发展都应该在对后代人满足需要不构成威胁的条件下，满足当代人需要[8]。

（二）概念模型与研究假设

​ 市集活动经济模式作为一种传统的商业模式，已经有了一套成熟的发展方式，但随着产业内部与外部环境的变化，现有的发展方式并不是非常奏效。因此，本文从内部和外部两个方面入手，研究市集活动可持续性的影响因素。内部因素主要是企业的资源能力，包括摊主资源，商品资源，资本资源等。运营能力也是重要的内部因素之一，好的运营能力意味着企业能够更好的推广宣传与组织，增加客户数量。外部因素主要包括四个方面，分别是政策环境，经济环境，社会环境和技术环境。政策环境主要讨论政府的相关政策是否支持市集活动开展。经济环境则是考虑当地消费水平与经济规模，以此来分析对于市集活动的影响。社会环境更注重顾客的习惯与体验，寻找社会走向，与潮流接轨。最后一个技术环境是关于实体经济与互联网相结合的考虑，由于科技不断进步，研究市集的模式是否需要创新等类似的问题。基于此，市集活动可持续性概念模型见图1。

2、数据分析总结

​ 通过表5主要体现了假设模型各项路径的标准化路径系数和t值，如表数据分析，共发现两条路径呈显著水平，四条路经未达到显著水平，故有四个假设不成立。根据主要应模型分析和研究假设的检验，可以得到图3所示的修正模型。

​ 通过对修正模型各变量的路径关系进行分析，可以发现以下结论：

（1）市集商业模式的可持续性的形成主要有两个影响因素：资源能力和政策环境因素。资源能力因子到市集可持续性因子间的标准化路径系数是0.745，达到了p<0.05显著性水平，政策环境因素因子到市集可持续性因子间的标准化系数路径是0.170，达到了p<0.001显著性水平，以上两个假设均得到证实。

（2）资源能力对于市集活动可持续性支持最为显著。资源能力是指市集运营模式在包括摊主资源, 品牌资源, 渠道资源, 举办场地资源, 资源利用, 资源创新方面触及，运用及拓展资源的能力。当市集能够拥有强大的资源能力时，它便能为该商业模式的持续做出客观条件上的支持，更好的满足了市集开展在物质与人力条件上的强烈需求，增强了市集发展的稳定性。稳定的市集商业环境能够为消费者提供良好的消费体验，在长期能够创造市集属于自己的品牌形象与名声。同时，资源及时的更新换代，如新摊主入驻，时下流行商品售卖，销售方式创新等，能够为市集商业模式面向更广的客户群体，持续发展和挖掘更多消费者。客户间信息的传播也可以成为一种宣传，营销的方式，有助于市集运营能力的提升。由此使得市集商业模式随着时代发展能够拥有客户群体方面的可持续性。

（3）政策环境因素显著支持市集可持续性。政策环境因素包括在市集举办与发展过程中，政府能够对此实行政策支持，制定相关行业活动规范与进行必要扶持的一系列举措。政府制定的具有支持性的相关政策能够为市集商业模式提供良好的环境，如资金支持，场地提供，技术创新等提供有效制度保障，助推市集的持续发展。政府制定相关行业的活动规范能够促使市集举办的规范化，既能使市集的开展更加有序，也有利于政府管控。同时，在市集商业模式进入其生命周期的衰退期时，及时的政府扶持可以帮助市集顺利过渡到新的生命周期，实现可持续。

五、结论与展望

（一）研究结论

​ 本文结合了目前国内外市集商业模式发展背景，探讨了市集商业模式可持续性的影响因素，帮助该商业模式在当今时代背景下实现可持续。结合本文的研究目的，整体研究思路围绕生命周期理论，将市集商业模式的持续发展分成四个阶段，从内外两方面探索商业模式可持续性的影响因素，并确定关键影响因素。经过验证分析结果表明，资源能力和政策环境是两个主要影响因素。企业拥有强大的资源能力对市集可持续性具有正向影响作用，拥有良好的政策环境对市集可持续性具有正向影响作用。

（二）管理启示

​ 本研究主要对市集可持续性机理进行研究，为提高本研究的实际指导意义，在明确市集商业模式可持续性关键影响因素后，提出以下管理对策：

1、加强拓展资源渠道，增强资源利用效率。资源的快速获取和高效利用对市集初期的发展尤为重要。在市集商业模式的初生阶段，资源充沛能够为商业模式打下坚实的基础，让其有能力去适应不断变化的外部环境，并更多的注重于对于客户需求的满足，为长期发展做准备。

2、坚持资源的持续创新，紧跟时代脚步。市集作为一种历史悠久的商业模式，需要不断优化自身的关键资源，才能更好的持续。关键资源的创新，可以通过商品资源的创新，对市集所售卖的商品进行及时的更新与创新，时刻为客户群体创造新鲜感，保留旧客户群体，拓展新客户群体。也可以通过技术创新的手段，通过新技术获取数据资源，为商业模式后续发展提供支持，新技术的发展和运用能够提高市集对于环境变化的敏锐性，同时也能在商品资源创新方面为客户打造更加精细个性化的体验。

3、积极促进市集的经济贡献与社会贡献，获取政府支持。 市集能够为当地的经济带来发展机遇，营造市集文化，吸引内地外地消费，促进经济发展。同时，增加新的就业岗位，为低收入人群创造就业机会，缓解社会问题。因此，市集便能够增加其社会影响力，获得政府的支持与扶持，从而增强其商业模式发展的稳定性。

（三）研究不足之处

​ 本研究仍然存在一些问题，有待后续改进，包括以下几点：

1、研究所收集的数据来自于一次在商场所举行的短期市集和网络传播问卷填写，数据收集对象不具有普遍性，问卷填写对象大多数为学生和商场游客，导致出现了主要的被调查者不了解市集的情况。

2、问卷的编写过于专业化，造成一些非专业人士填写问卷困难的问题。因以上原因，导致收集的调查问卷区分度不够高，区别效度未能达标，说明有大量数据雷同，使样本缺乏在验证结论的有效性。经过删除无效样本，该问题得到改善，除第二个因子外，其余平均抽取方差AVE的平方根均大于各因子与其他因子的相关系数，因此模型具有了良好的区别效度。

3、六个假设影响因素其中的四个，包括运营能力，社会环境因素，经济环境因素和技术环境因素对市集可持续性不支持，其原因有待进一步研究。
